data.title: Bagel country
data.text: A pleasant place with a convenient location downtown.  The menu is used for all of the restaurants, but there is something that seems fresh here.

data.title: Freshest bagels in town
data.text: A great lunch choice for quick service, varied selection of bagels and spreads.  The soups are good warmers on cool day.  The staff is efficient and friendly.  So glad you are downtown.

data.title: Amazing Bagels
data.text: Best bagel in Iowa City area. Friendly staff and service. Quick in quick out. They also have an amazing sandwich selection.

data.title: A bag of bagels
data.text: A great baker's dozen of bagels can be gotten here.  You can eat here and they do serve bagel sandwiches.  However, the best way to use this restaurant is to grab a bag of bagels and a couple tubs of their cream cheese (several flavor to choose from) and head for home.  Nothing like a Brueeggers bagel with Honey Walnut cream cheese warmed in the microwave at home.

data.title: Fresh food & good coffee
data.text: Fresh bagels, good sandwiches, good coffee. No complaints here. The service is fairly quick if the line is not too long, and the price is right.

data.title: Bagel bliss
data.text: Hot freshly made bagels - several varieties - multiple cream cheeses choices and other toppings available including hot or cold bagel sandwiches. A few other bakery items available as well as coffees and other beverages. Get an office pack to go for your next office meeting. Always busy any morning I have been there but never a huge wait.

data.title: Warm and Yummy
data.text:
Downtown Iowa City (a block from the center of the U. of Iowa campus). Part of a chain of "Midiwestern nice" bagel shops with bagels as good as New York's best.... without the attitude. Constantly offer up new takes on bagel sandwich fare. Friendly service staff set a high bar for all in the service business.
Right up there with the likes of Trader Joe's, Nordstrom, Culver's and Hy Vee.

data.title: Bagels to Sink Your Teeth Into--With Great Sandwich Makings
data.text: Brueggers only problem that I have seen is that once you try a sandwich you tend to reorder every time. If you try something new then you're really faced with an issue--which of your "favorites" to try again.  I love the salmon sandwich with one of their many Naked brand fruit juices.  Breakfast, lunch, or dinner you can't go wrong.

data.title: Great sandwiches
data.text: Stopped here for breakfast and had the brisket & egg...wow!  Really good and the coffee was surprisingly good.  First visit but I won't be shy about stopping in again.

data.title: A Bruegger's Bagel Anytime
data.text: A stop at any Brueggers Bagels is a good stop.  Always fresh, great for breakfast, lunch or dinner.  Especially like the fresh squeezed orange juice.

data.title: Almost EXCELLENT.  Best bagels in town.
data.text: Most authentic bagels in Iowa; nothing else comes close.  However, over the last few years, their prices have gone way up and their selection has gone gentile.  The only authentics left are poppy seed, sesame seed, plain and pumpernickel.  If you want onion or garlic bagels, you have to go with everything.  The authentic bagels have been crowded out by impostors such as raisin cinnamon, sticky sugar, blueberry, pepper and the like.  I like poppy best, but I have to call ahead to get a dozen because they only make a few.  On the other hand, the sandwiches are absolutely sublime.  I haven't tried the soups, chips and desserts, but I hear they are also great.  I would give an excellent rating, but the loss of the authentics from this close to authentic store, and the prices lower it a bit.  All in all, though, a great place.

data.title: BEST bagels in town!!!
data.text: I have been going to Brueggers for about 10 years and I love it.  There are several locations in Iowa City and their bagel sandwiches and bagels with cream cheese are great.  I love the veggie cream cheese and asiago bagels.  I typically buy a half dozen bagels and cream cheese to go so I can enjoy it for several days.

data.title: Bagels
data.text: fast service and great breakfast sandwinches. Cost is moderate. Location is easy to get too. Have plenty of bagels to choose from.

data.title: This is not a HyVee bagel
data.text: Great NY bagels with cream cheese and more.  I am often there in the a.m. to get my carbs for the day.

data.title: Rosemary and Olive Oil Bagels
data.text: The warm bagels of many flavors keep me coming back and I only wish the tomato basil soup hadn't been modified to creamy from its original more refreshing concept.

data.title: We returned to Brueggers
data.text:
We used to go to Brueggers when we lived in Iowa City.  This was our first return visit in quite some time.  So many changes-for one thing, there is now more than one Brueggers in Iowa City.

The quality of food is still excellent and there's more than bagels (pastries, bagel sandwiches).  We each had a bagel/cream cheese which were yummy.  The coffee hits the spot-I had caramel/sea salt. 

We will definitely return next time we're in Iowa City.

(An added plus is that this Brueggers is down town and there are lots of photo-ops nearby.)

data.title: Best cinnamon raisin bagels
data.text: I have been going to Brueggers for many years to get their cinnamon raisin bagels.  They are the  best I have found in the area.
